item.title: â€œThereâ€™s one state where the qualified-immunity push has...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

â€œThereâ€™s one state where the qualified-immunity push has played out differently: Colorado.

The state is now serving as a litmus test for the alarming predictions by police nationwide that eliminating qualified immunity would severely hamper their profession.

So far, few negative effects on policing have been evidentâ€¦ â€œ Washington Post

Only Colorado has passed legislation allowing residents to name individual officers in lawsuits â€” but even there, police wouldnâ€™t have to pay the judgment.

washingtonpost.com

Dozens of states have tried to end qualified immunity. Police officers and unions helped beat nearly every bill.

Only Colorado has passed legislation allowing residents to name individual officers in lawsuits â€” but even there, police wouldnâ€™t have to pay the judgment.Only Colorado has passed legislation allowing residents to name individual officers in lawsuits â€” but even there, police wouldnâ€™t have to pay the judgment.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

â€œFrom new rules on how and when the powerful sedative ketamine can be administered in situations involving law enforcement to a ban on neck holds, Colorado lawmakers took steps in 2020 and 2021 that proponents of police reform hope will prevent unnecessary deaths and bolster accountability for law enforcement across the state.â€

Elijah McClainâ€™s death two years ago inspired a wave of new laws from the Colorado legislature and Gov. Jared Polis aimed at preventing something similar from ever happening again.

Representative Leslie Herod

â€œFrom new rules about how and when ketamine can be administered to a ban on carotid and choke holds, Colorado lawmakers have taken steps to prevent a death like McClainâ€™s from happening again.â€

Representative Leslie Herod

Representative Leslie Herod was elected in 2016 as the first LGBTQ African American in the General Assembly. She is Chair of the House Finance Committee, Vice-Chair of the House Judiciary Committee and Chair of the Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.Representative Leslie Herod was elected in 2016 as the first LGBTQ African American in the General Assembly. She is Chair of the House Finance Committee, Vice-Chair of the House Judiciary Committee and Chair of the Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.

item.title: â€œAURORA, Colo â€” The death of Elijah McClain brought many new...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

â€œAURORA, Colo â€” The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice. Many people assured his family they would fight for justice, including lawmakers.

â€œWe're not divided. Give peace a chance, because it really does work,â€ Elijahâ€™s mother, Sheneen McClain, said.

Sheneen McClain said those words at a protest in Denver on June 27, 2020. That day marked a new beginning for Sheneen and Colorado Rep. Leslie Herod.â€

The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.

9news.com

Colorado leaders react to indictment in Elijah McClain case

The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.

Through the Behavioral Health Assistance Program, weâ€™re ensuring that the African American community in Denver is matched with therapists that â€˜look like youâ€™ and who understand the communityâ€™s needs when it comes to mental health.â€

â€œThe stars and community leaders of Park Hill will be out and about Saturday, Aug. 28, for the fun-filled, history-packed Park Hill Day of Legends event at Skyland Park.

The event, hosted by the Park Hill Pirates Youth Sports Organization, will take place from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at the park located at 35th Avenue between Holly and Ivy Streets.â€

Food trucks, bounce houses, music and more at Skyland Park.

item.title: Representative Leslie HerodDan GibbsColorado Parks and Wildlife has extended the deadline to apply to be a Board member of the newly created...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodDan Gibbs

Colorado Parks and Wildlife has extended the deadline to apply to be a Board member of the newly created Outdoor Equity Grant Program, passed this legislative s...ession. The Program's goal is to increase access and opportunity for underserved youth and their families to experience Colorado's state parks and outdoor spaces.

The Board is a key part of our efforts to give more Coloradans the experience, joy, freedom, and inspiration of being in our vast great outdoors. It is also supported by Governor Jared Polis and Coloradans working to create more diverse outdoor spaces. Including champions Leslie Herod David Ortiz for Colorado Leroy M. Garcia Sonya Jaquez Lewis and many nonprofit partners including Next 100 Coalition: Public Lands for All Blackpackers GreenLatinos Latino Outdoors Colorado Environmental Learning for Kids Conservation Colorado Western Resource Advocates Continental Divide Trail Coalition The Colorado Nature Conservancy and many others as part of the Outdoor Equity Fund Coalition.

Apply today: https://cpw.state.co.us/abouâ€¦/Pages/Outdoor-Equity-Fund.aspx

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.â€
